original_solution_mapping.L1: There are 7 days in a week, so if he doesn't go to work for 3 days, he goes 7-3 = <<7-3=4>>4 days every week
original_solution_mapping.L2: He travels 140km each day for a weekly total of 140*4 = <<140*4=560>>560km
original_solution_mapping.L3: In 4 weeks he will travel a total of 4*560 = <<4*560=2240>>2240km

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2941.
    Returns: the total distance Francine drives to work for 4 weeks.
    """
    # L1
    days_in_week = 7 # WK
    days_not_at_work_per_week = 3 # 3 days every week
    days_at_work_per_week = days_in_week - days_not_at_work_per_week

    # L2
    distance_per_day = 140 # drives 140km to work each day
    distance_per_week = distance_per_day * days_at_work_per_week

    # L3
    num_weeks = 4 # for 4 weeks
    total_distance = num_weeks * distance_per_week

    # FA
    answer = total_distance
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: There are {days_in_week} days in a week, so if he doesn't go to work for {days_not_at_work_per_week} days, he goes {days_in_week}-{days_not_at_work_per_week} = <<{days_in_week}-{days_not_at_work_per_week}={days_at_work_per_week}>>{days_at_work_per_week} days every week
He travels {distance_per_day}km each day for a weekly total of {distance_per_day}*{days_at_work_per_week} = <<{distance_per_day}*{days_at_work_per_week}={distance_per_week}>>{distance_per_week}km
In {num_weeks} weeks he will travel a total of {num_weeks}*{distance_per_week} = <<{num_weeks}*{distance_per_week}={total_distance}>>{total_distance}km

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: There are 7 days in a week, so if he doesn't go to work for 3 days, he goes 7-3 = <<7-3=10>>10 days every week
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He travels 140km each day for a weekly total of 140*10 = <<140*10=1400>>1400km
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: In 4 weeks he will travel a total of 4*1400 = <<4*1400=5600>>5600km
